data.title: Walgreen Co. agreed to acquire remaining 55% stake in Alliance Boots GmbH from AB Acquisitions Holdings Limited for £9.1 billion.
data.meta_description: Walgreen Co.  agreed to acquire remaining 55% stake in Alliance Boots GmbH from AB Acquisitions Holdings Limited for £9.1 billion in cash and stock on August 5, 2014. Under the terms of the...
data.text:
Walgreen Co. (NYSE:WAG) agreed to acquire remaining 55% stake in Alliance Boots GmbH from AB Acquisitions Holdings Limited for £9.1 billion in cash and stock on August 5, 2014. Under the terms of the acquisition, Walgreen exercised the option to acquire the remaining stake in Alliance Boots and agreed to pay £3.13 billion in cash and 144.3 million shares of common stock of Walgreens and will assume Alliance's outstanding debt. A new holding company to be formed in connection with the transaction will be named Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc., and will include four divisions including Walgreen Co. and Boots. For the year ending March 31, 2014, Alliance Boots GmbH had revenue of £23.37 billion, Total Assets of £17.45 billion, EBITDA of £1.51 billion, Net Income of £971 million, total common equity of £6.2 billion and earnings from discontinued operations of £971 million.

The fully combined Walgreens Boots Alliance global enterprise will be domiciled in the United States and headquartered in the Chicago area. Walgreens operational HQ will remain in Deerfield, Ill., and Boots operational HQ will remain in Nottingham, U.K. Upon closing, the combined enterprise will blend senior management from both companies including Walgreens President, Chief Executive Officer and Board member Greg Wasson who will be president and Chief Executive Officer of Walgreens Boots Alliance, and Stefano Pessina, Executive Chairman of Alliance Boots, who will be Executive Vice Chairman of Walgreens Boots Alliance responsible for strategy and M&A reporting to Wasson, and Chairman of a new strategy committee of the Board of Directors. Jim Skinner will serve as the Non-Executive Chairman of the Board of Directors for Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. Ornella Barra, Chief Executive Officer of Wholesale and Brands of Alliance Boots, will become Executive Vice President of Walgreens Boots Alliance and President and Chief Executive of global wholesale and international retail. Jeff Berkowitz who is President of Walgreens Boots Alliance Development GmbH, will serve as Executive Vice President of Walgreens Boots Alliance and President of pharma and global market access. Ornella Barra, Chief Executive Officer of Wholesale and Brands of Alliance Boots, will become Executive Vice President of Walgreens Boots Alliance and President and Chief Executive of global wholesale and international retail. Alex Gourlay, Walgreen Co President of customer experience and daily living will become Executive Vice President of Walgreens Boots Alliance and president of Walgreens. Post acquisition James A. Skinner will join as Chairman of the combined company.

The transaction is subject to Walgreen Co.'s shareholder approval and various regulatory approvals and is expected to complete in the first quarter of calendar 2015. Walgreen Co intends to use the net proceeds from the offering to fund a portion of the cash consideration in connection with the acquisition of the 55% interest in Alliance Boots GmbH that Walgreens does not currently own, to refinance substantially all of Alliance Boots' existing borrowings, to pay related fees and expenses, and for general corporate purposes.

In connection with the proposed transactions between Walgreen Co. and Alliance Boots GmbH, Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. has filed with the SEC a registration statement on Form S-4 and two amendments, as well as a definitive prospectus of Walgreens Boots Alliance and a definitive proxy statement of Walgreens in connection with the transaction. The registration statement, as amended was declared effective by the SEC on November 24, 2014, and the definitive proxy statement/prospectus was mailed to Walgreens' shareholders on or about November 24, 2014. On December 19, 2014, Walgreen Co. announced it intends to apply to list the shares of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. common stock on The Nasdaq Stock Market LLC under the ticker symbol "WBA" following the closing of the previously announced reorganization of Walgreens into a holding company structure pursuant to a merger of a wholly owned subsidiary of Walgreens with and into Walgreens in which issued and outstanding shares of Walgreens common stock will be converted automatically into the right to receive shares of Walgreens Boots Alliance common stock on a one-for-one basis, and the acquisition of the remaining 55 percent of Alliance Boots GmbH that it does not currently own. Listing will be subject to the closing of the Reorg Merger and to Walgreens Boots Alliance fulfilling all of the listing requirements of the Nasdaq Stock Market. As announced on December 28, 2014, the shareholders of Walgreens are scheduled to vote today to approve the merger. As of December 29, 2014, Walgreens shareholders approved all proposals related to transaction with Alliance Boots.

Jeff Cohen, Gerald Rosenfeld and Jason Wooten of Lazard Frères & Co. LLC and Goldman, Sachs & Co. acted as the financial advisors. Lazard as well as Goldman, Sachs & Co. also provided the fairness opinion to the respective parties. Justin Steer, Paul Glazener and Emily Baker of Allen Overy acted as legal advisors to Walgreens. Eduardo Gallardo and Dennis Friedman alongside Saee Muzumdar of Gibson Dunn & Crutcher acted as financial advisors for Walgreens. Ben Burman of Darrois Villey Maillot Brochier and Mark Pflug, Nicole Tague, Karen McClendon, Jivaji Moré and Neil Evans, Ian Barratt, Shahpur Kabraji, Michael Nathan, Frank Marinelli, James Rapp, Rob Holo, Meredith Jones, Devin Heckman, and Sharo Atmeh of Simpson Thacher & Bartlett acted as legal advisors to AB Acquisitions' parent, Kohlberg Kravis Roberts in the deal. Centerview Partners and Deutsche Bank AG acted as financial advisors to Alliance Boots in the deal. Andrew R. Brownstein, Benjamin M. Roth, Kathryn Gettles-Atwa, Edward J. Lee, Jacob A. Kling, Matthew I. Danzig, Chelsea N. Darnell, Michael J. Segal, Erica E. Bonnett, Stephen R. DiPrima, Ralph M. Levene, Benjamin D. Klein, Lauren M. Kofke, Eric M. Rosof, Michael S. Benn, Benjamin S. Arfa, T. Eiko Stange and Tijana J. Dvornic of Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz acted as the legal advisor to Walgreen Co. Cleary, Gottlieb, Steen & Hamilton LLP acted as legal advisor for Goldman, Sachs. Innisfree M&A Incorporated acted as information agent to Walgreens and will receive a fee of $0.08 million (£0.04 million). Goldman Sachs will receive a fee of $42.5 million (£25.2 million). Walgreens has agreed to pay to Lazard an aggregate fee of approximately $4 million (£2.4 million). Debevoise & Plimpton LLP acted as legal advisor and Deloitte Tax LLP and KPMG LLP acted as tax advisors to Alliance Boots. Baker & McKenzie LLP acted as legal advisor and PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP and Ernst & Young LLP acted as tax advisors to Walgreens. O'Melveny & Myers, LLP acted as legal advisor for Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. The currency conversion is made from www.oanda.com as on August 6, 2014. Thomas U. Reutter, Roland Truffer, Daniel Heiniger, Annette Weber, Rebecca Schori and Anna Capaul of Bär & Karrer AG acted as the legal advisor, Wells Fargo Shareowner Services acted as the transfer agent to Walgreens.
